contentrichtext.text: {{other uses|Young Island (disambiguation)}} <!-- BEGIN WikiProject Mountains infobox (scroll down to edit main article text) --> {{Infobox islands | name = Young Island | image name = Balleny Map.jpg|thumb | image caption = Young Island is the northernmost of the [[Balleny Islands]] | locator map = LocationBalleny.png|thumb | map caption = Location of the Balleny Islands | nickname = | location = [[Antarctica]] | coordinates = {{coord|66|17|S|162|25|E|}} | archipelago = Balleny Islands | total islands = | major islands = | area_km2 = | length_km = 11 | width_km = 3.5 | highest mount = | elevation_m = 1340 | population = Uninhabited | population as of = | density_km2 = | ethnic groups = | country = [[Ross Dependency]] | additional info = Administered under the [[Antarctic Treaty System]] }} {| border="1" bgcolor="#ffffff" cellpadding="5" align="right" width="305" style="margin-left:3px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Young Island |- |align=center colspan=2|. |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Elevation]]:||{{convert|1340|m|ft|abbr=on}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3 width=90|[[Geographic coordinates|Coordinates]]: |width=215|{{coord|66.42|S|162.45|E|type:mountain}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Location:||[[Antarctica|Subantarctic island]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[List of mountain types|Type]]:||[[Stratovolcano]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Last eruption]]:||Unknown |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[First ascent]]:||Unknown |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Easiest [[mountaineering|route]]:||Unknown |} <!-- END WikiProject Mountains infobox --> '''Young Island''' ({{coord|66|17|S|162|25|E|}}) is the northernmost and westernmost of the three main islands in the uninhabited [[Balleny Islands]] group located in the [[Southern Ocean]]. It lies {{convert|8|km|mi}} northwest of [[Buckle Island]], some {{convert|115|km|mi}} north-northeast of [[Belousov Point]] on the Antarctic mainland. The island is roughly semi-oval in shape, with a long straight east coast and a curved west coast meeting at Cape Scoresby in the south and Cape Ellsworth in the north. The distance between these two capes is {{convert|11|km|mi}}, and at its widest the island is {{convert|3.5|km|mi}} across. The island is volcanic, with active [[fumarole]]s, and a height of {{convert|1340|m|ft|abbr=off}}. It is entirely covered with snow. Several small islets lie in the channel separating Cape Scoresby and Buckle Island, the largest of which is [[Borradaile Island]]. Several [[sea stack]]s lie off the island's northern tip. These are known as the Seal Rocks. The island forms part of the [[Ross Dependency]], claimed by [[New Zealand]] (see [[Antarctic territorial claims]]). == See also == * [[Antarctic Treaty System]] * [[Composite Antarctic Gazetteer]] * [[List of Antarctic and sub-Antarctic islands#List of Antarctic islands south of 60° S|List of Antarctic islands south of 60° S]] * [[Scientific Committee on Antarctic Research|SCAR]] * [[Territorial claims in Antarctica]] ==References== * {{cite book | last = LeMasurier | first = W. E. | coauthors = Thomson, J. W. (eds.) | title = Volcanoes of the Antarctic Plate and Southern Oceans | publisher = [[American Geophysical Union]] | date = 1990 | isbn = 0-87590-172-7 | page = 512 pp }} [[Category:Stratovolcanoes]] [[Category:Volcanoes of New Zealand]] [[Category:Volcanoes of the Balleny Islands]] [[Category:Islands of the Balleny Islands]] {{OutlyingNZ-geo-stub}}
